```{r include = FALSE}
# Use list() to construct a list, all elements can have different types and lengths:
```
```{r 04-use-list-to-construct-a-list-all-elements-can-have-different-types-and-lengths}
list(1, 2, 3)
list(1:3, 5)
list(1:3, "5")
```


```{r include = FALSE}
# Lists can be nested:
```
```{r 04-lists-can-be-nested}
list(
  1:3,
  list(4, "5"),
  list(
    list(letters[6:8]),
    9
  )
)
```


```{r include = FALSE}
# Vectors and lists can have names:
```
```{r 04-vectors-and-lists-can-have-names}
c(a = 1, b = 2, c = 3)
list(a = 1:3, b = 5)
```


```{r include = FALSE}
# Preview: vctrs::list_of() to construct typed lists
```
```{r 04-preview-vctrs-list-of-to-construct-typed-lists}
vctrs::list_of(1, 2, 3)
vctrs::list_of(letters[1:3], "e")
```
